system.biography:
TitleFFF 325-2 Pilot
Birthday20 Morgat 685
AppearanceAge 34, height 6‚Äô, medium frame, weight 170 lb, average appearance, fair complexion, red hair, blue eyes
Medical/PsycheNone
Size6
ArmorFine cloth tunic and leggings, velvet tabard embroidered with the most outrageous floral pattern, very fashionable leather shoes, and dagger. He can draw weapons and armour from the arms locker, but only if combat is expected.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch
Valuables88d in silver in a money pouch
Notes

Biography

Hoban Fi√¥rfohd (Fi√¥r for short) hails from Kolorn in landlocked Kaldor. As a child, growing up, he had a strange affinity for water and would often ‚Äòmess about in boats‚Äô on the Kald River. He was an excellent fisherman, supplementing his family‚Äôs diet with his catch. However, there was always something missing in his life. Then one day, he met a merchant friend of his father. The man described his many travels about huge ocean going ships. Fi√¥r was entranced. He had to see the sea. The youngest son of a woodcrafter, he had little hope of ever being more than a journeyman to his older brother and he couldn‚Äôt get the dreams of the sea out of his mind. So, at eighteen he took his family‚Äôs leave and headed south to Melderyn and the sea.

Working odd jobs, Fi√¥r made his way to Thay where he found employment as a seaman. He took to the sea ‚Äòlike a duck to water‚Äô. He quickly made ordinary seaman, where a sympathetic pilot spotted his skill and took him on as his apprentice. He served nine years with three different pilots, quickly outstripping all of them and passing his exams with ease. A natural pilot, he was rarely short of work, however he wanted more. He found it in the form of a shady Jarin captain named Sh√¢ and his stunning first mate, Zo√´. Fi√¥r came with a list of references as long as his leg, but found a home on the Lorkin.

Married in 715TR, Fi√¥r is Zo√´'s amusingly insecure husband. He is charming and romantic. Zo√´ loves him dearly, but Fi√¥r worries she may still have feelings for the Captain and is jealous of their shared history and shorthand banter. He doesn‚Äôt like the way Zo√´ tends to blindly (in his opinion) follow the Captain‚Äôs orders. Unassuming and self-deprecating, he is pretty far from the fiery hero type. Instead, he is laid back and calm (once he was laconic) with a great sense of humour.

Adventure Hooks

You Want to Go Where? The PCs need to get somewhere difficult. They need a ship and a crackerjack pilot and the Lorkin and Fi√¥r come highly recommended. If anyone can get them ashore it is the crew of the Lorkin.

Mr. Wisecrack. The PCs are in a bar in a port town. They run into a bizarre man with fiery red hair wearing the most outrageous tabard. He steps back and takes a quick verbal shot at the PCs. If they take offence, they will find he has some very dangerous friends.

Delivery Gone Wrong. The PCs have hired Sh√¢ and his crew to deliver some goods. Accompanied by Fi√¥r, he meets the PCs in an out of the way spot. During the delivery, everything goes to hell as a group of pirates snatch Sh√¢ and Fi√¥r for their boss, Esobran of Geltyne.

Credits

Robin Crossby.
